info.title: Circle Public API
info.description:
The Circle API allows community admins to perform programmatic actions on or retrieve data from their community.

Community admins can obtain an API key by going to the Settings → API page in their community. Please keep your key private — do not share your key with anyone or make it publicly accessible in any form.

The main purpose of the Circle API is to allow Circle's community admins to build bulk automations, migration scripts, and access data for reporting purposes. Our API is not meant to be used on the browser/client side, or to re-create your own Circle app from scratch.

get.description: Return information about the API key owner.
Returns a list of all the communities associated with the admin account of the API key.
Returns information about a specific community associated with the admin account of the API key.
Retrieve information about all the space groups in your community.

post.description: Create a new space group in a community.

schema.example:
{"success": true,
 "message": "Space Group created.",
 "space_group": 
  {"id": 3,
   "name": "Veniam",
   "is_hidden_from_non_members": false,
   "allow_members_to_create_spaces": true,
   "community_id": 1,
   "space_order_array": nil,
   "created_at": "2022-06-17T13:22:33.256Z",

   "automatically_add_members_to_new_spaces": false,
   "add_members_to_space_group_on_space_join": false,
   "slug": "veniam-ut",
   "hide_non_member_spaces_from_sidebar": true,
   "space_group_members_count": 1}}

get.description: Retrieve information about a particular space group in your community.

put.description: Update an existing space group in a community

delete.description: Deletes a space group from a community.

example.message: The space group has been removed from the community

post.description: Given an email, this endpoint will add a new member to a space group and to all the spaces within it. (For the member to be added to the space group, you'll need to ensure that they've already been added to your community.)

delete.description: Given an email, you can remove a member from a space group.

get.description: Retrieve information about a set of spaces in your community.

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description: Default: latest

parameters.name: per_page
parameters.description: Default: 60, Max: 100

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Default: 1

post.description: Create a new space in your community.

parameters.name: space_group_id
parameters.description: The ID of the space group

get.description: Retrieve information about a particular space in your community.

delete.description: Remove a space from your community.

post.description: Given an email, this endpoint will add a member to a particular space. (For the member to be added to the space, you'll need to ensure that they've already been added to your community.)

delete.description: Given an email, you can remove a member from a space.

get.description: Retrieve all the posts in a given space.

post.description: Create a new post in a given space.

parameters.name: skip_notifications
parameters.description: Default: false

get.description: Retrieve a particular post given its ID.

text/plain.example: ahoy_visit=086e3ea6-a242-430b-b3ab-edcb9a149118; domain=.circle.so; path=/; expires=Wed, 29 Sep 2021 20:46:33 GMT; Secure; SameSite=None

get.description: Retrieve all the comments in a given space OR a specific post.

parameters.name: post_id
parameters.description: Optional

parameters.name: topic_id
parameters.description: This is deprecated. Use post_id.

post.description: Create a new post in a space.

parameters.name: post_id
parameters.description: optional

get.description: Retrieve a specific comment given its ID.

text/plain.example: ahoy_visit=1d4515d3-4cba-4702-bbef-b90649ebf5ab; domain=.circle.so; path=/; expires=Wed, 29 Sep 2021 20:52:11 GMT; Secure; SameSite=None

get.description:
Retrieve a set of members from your community. Uses per_page and page params to paginate results.

**Response keys**

*   sso_provider_user_id:
    *   Only applicable to communities which using SSO to login.
    *   It is the unique identifier or user id sent by the SSO provider as part of the user info response.
    *   It can still be null if the member has never logged into circle yet.

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description: other option: oldest, Default: latest

parameters.name: per_page
parameters.description: Default: 10, Max: 100

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Default: 1

example:
user: puneetsutar
USE eager loading detected
  CommunityMember => [:avatar_attachment]
  Add to your query: .includes([:avatar_attachment])
Call stack
  /Users/puneetsutar/workspace/circle/app/helpers/user_helper.rb:7:in `generate_avatar_url'
  /Users/puneetsutar/workspace/circle/app/helpers/user_helper.rb:19:in `avatar_url_for'
  /Users/puneetsutar/workspace/circle/app/models/community_member.rb:190:in `as_json'
  /Users/puneetsutar/workspace/circle/app/controllers/api/v1/community_members_controller.rb:9:in `index'

user: puneetsutar
AVOID eager loading detected
  User => [:avatar_attachment]
  Remove from your query: .includes([:avatar_attachment])
Call stack

text/plain.example: ahoy_visit=bfbd208a-0068-46e8-9d0a-a1f59c3572fe; domain=.sso-test.com; path=/; expires=Sat, 12 Mar 2022 00:48:00 GMT; SameSite=None

post.description:
Invite a new member to your community. Optionally, pass an array of IDs for spaces or space groups for them to be added to automatically along with the invite.

Note:
- You can either invite a member with a set password, or no password. If no password is specified, they'll receive an invitation email *unless* they have an account with Circle already.
- If you pass the skip_invitation=true flag, they won't receive an email and won't have a password set - the invitation will need to be triggered manually via Circle Support, or in your Members area → Member dropdown → Resend invitation email.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: John Doe

parameters.name: space_ids[]
parameters.description: (Optional) JSON body array of space IDs for the spaces they should be added to.

parameters.name: space_group_ids[]
parameters.description: (Optional) JSON body array of space group IDs for the space groups they should be added to.

parameters.name: member_tag_ids[]
parameters.description: (Optional) JSON body array of member tag IDs for the member tags they should assigned with.

parameters.name: bio
parameters.description: Max length: 250 characters. This field can only be set if the member does not already have an account with Circle.

parameters.name: headline
parameters.description: This field can only be set if the member does not already have an account with Circle.

parameters.name: facebook_url
parameters.description: This field can only be set if the member does not already have an account with Circle.

parameters.name: twitter_url
parameters.description: This field can only be set if the member does not already have an account with Circle.

parameters.name: instagram_url
parameters.description: This field can only be set if the member does not already have an account with Circle.

parameters.name: linkedin_url
parameters.description: This field can only be set if the member does not already have an account with Circle.

parameters.name: website_url
parameters.description: This field can only be set if the member does not already have an account with Circle.

parameters.name: avatar
parameters.description: Avatar URL for their profile image. This field can only be set if the member does not already have an account with Circle.

parameters.name: skip_invitation
parameters.description: Always true if password is set, false if no password.

delete.description: Note: unless your community has Single Sign-On enabled, this member will be removed from your community, but not from Circle. Your member(s) will need to contact support@circle.so to get their centralized Circle account removed.

get.description: Retrieve a specific member from your community, given an ID.

parameters.name: bio
parameters.description: Max length: 250 characters.

get.description: Retrieve all the member tags from your community.
Retrieve a specific member tag given the ID of a member tag.
Retrieve a list of all the tagged members in your community.

post.description: Tag one or many community members with a given member tag.

parameters.name: user_email
parameters.description: The email of the member you'd like to tag.

parameters.name: member_tag_id
parameters.description: The ID of the member tag you'd like to tag the member with.

parameters.name: member_tag_id
parameters.description: The ID of the member tag you'd like to untag from the member

parameters.name: email
parameters.description: The email of the member you'd like to untag.

get.description: Retrieve all the tagged member record given an ID.

post.description: Given a list of community member emails ids, this request will create a group chat for these members and send the message from message body.

parameters.name: community_id
parameters.description: Community id

parameters.name: message_body
parameters.description: First message in newly created group chat

get.description: Retrieve a set of community member charges from a community. Uses per_page and page params to paginate results.

text/plain.example: ahoy_visit=9c9e988a-a626-4029-a73b-df940690b0c3; domain=.circle.so; path=/; expires=Fri, 21 Jan 2022 20:50:21 GMT; Secure; SameSite=None

get.description: Retrieve all the user likes for a given post.

post.description: The API create a like on the post for the provided `user_email` user. If `user_email` parameter is not passed then it creates a post like for the admin user.

delete.description: The API deletes a like on the post for the provided `user_email` user. If `user_email` parameter is not passed then it deletes a post like for the admin user.

post.description: The API create a like on the comment for the provided `user_email` user. If `user_email` parameter is not passed then it creates a comment like for the admin user.

delete.description: The API deletes a like on the comment for the provided `user_email` user. If `user_email` parameter is not passed then it deletes a comment like for the admin user.

example.message: The space group has been removed from the community

tags.name: Me
tags.description: The Me API lets you retrieve information about you, the owner of the API key being used to authenticate with the Circle API.

tags.name: Communities
tags.description: The Communities API lets you retrieve information about the communities associated with your admin account. Either as a list or individually. This endpoint will return the community ID, which you may need for your other requests.

tags.name: Space Group
tags.description: The Space Groups API lets you retrieve information about the space groups on your community. Either as a list or individually.

tags.name: Space Group Members
tags.description: The Space Group Members API lets you add or remove members from space groups in your community.

tags.name: Spaces
tags.description: The Spaces API lets you retrieve, create, or delete spaces in your community.

tags.name: Space Members
tags.description: The Space Members API lets you add or remove members from spaces in your community.

tags.name: Posts
tags.description: The Posts API lets you retrieve, create, or delete posts in your community — on your own behalf or on behalf of other members.

tags.name: Comments
tags.description: The Comments API lets you retrieve, create, or delete comments in your community — on your own behalf or on behalf of other members.

tags.name: Members
tags.description: The Members API lets you retrieve, invite, or remove members from your community.

tags.name: Member Tag
tags.description: The Member Tags API lets you retrieve the member tags in your community.

tags.name: Tagged Members
tags.description: The Tagged Members API lets you tag or untag members with a specific member tag, or retrieve lists members that have been tagged with a member tag.

tags.name: Direct Messages
tags.description: The Direct Messages API lets you direct message a specific member.

tags.name: Member Subscriptions
tags.description: The Community member subscriptions API lets you retrieve subscriptions created through Paywalls for a specific community

tags.name: Member Charges
tags.description: The Community member charges API lets you retrieve charges created through Paywalls for a specific community

tags.name: Post Likes
tags.description: APIs for post like, unlike and getting list of likes.

tags.name: Comment Likes
tags.description: APIs for comment like, unlike and getting list of likes
